item.title: [PI] Giveitem doesnt work for players with spaces in name
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:14, topic:422498”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=525165.msg3824416#msg3824416 date=1322057700]
Here…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("giveitem")) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split("-", 2); String otherplayer = args[1]; int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[3]); //String otherplayer = args[3]; Client c2 = null; for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(otherplayer)) { c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; } } } if (c2 == null) { c.sendMessage("Player doesn't exist."); return; } c.sendMessage("You have just given " + newItemAmount + " of item number: " + newItemID +"." ); c2.sendMessage("You have just been given item(s)." ); c2.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } catch(Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); c.sendMessage("Use as ::giveitem-playername-id-amount."); } }
Post here the exception caught.
[/quote]
You realize that ours are literally 100% the exact same code? ^.^[/quote]
98.1%

e.printStackTrace();
durrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr

item.title: [PI] Giveitem doesnt work for players with spaces in name
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Dario14:

Just tried that and that didn’t work either, it also didnt even work with people that had no space in there name it just said player doesn’t exist

if (playerCommand.startsWith("giveitem")) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split("-", 2); String otherplayer = args[1]; int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[3]); //String otherplayer = args[3]; Client c2 = null; for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(otherplayer)) { c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; } } } if (c2 == null) { c.sendMessage("Player doesn't exist."); return; } c.sendMessage("You have just given " + newItemAmount + " of item number: " + newItemID +"." ); c2.sendMessage("You have just been given item(s)." ); c2.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Use as ::giveitem-playername-id-amount."); } }
Fixed it… You had a pointless break in there.

item.title: [PI] Giveitem doesnt work for players with spaces in name
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[code=java] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“giveitem”)) {

try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split("");
String otherplayer = args[1].replaceAll("", " “);
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
Client c2 = null;
for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(otherplayer)) {
c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
break;
}
}
}
if (c2 == null) {
c.sendMessage(“Player doesn’t exist.”);
return;
}
c.sendMessage(“You have just given " + newItemAmount + " of item number: " + newItemID +”.” );
c2.sendMessage(“You have just been given item(s).” );
c2.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} catch(Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::giveitem ID AMOUNT PLAYERNAME.”);
}
}[/code]

giveitem_id_amount_player name

item.title: [PI] Giveitem doesnt work for players with spaces in name
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("giveitem")) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split("-", 2); String otherplayer = args[1]; int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[3]); //String otherplayer = args[3]; Client c2 = null; for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(otherplayer)) { c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; break; } } } if (c2 == null) { c.sendMessage("Player doesn't exist."); return; } c.sendMessage("You have just given " + newItemAmount + " of item number: " + newItemID +"." ); c2.sendMessage("You have just been given item(s)." ); c2.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Use as ::giveitem-playername-id-amount."); } }

“Use as ::giveitem-playername-id-amount.”

Edit: Use mine. The ones posted before me are incorrect, or unnecessary.

item.title: [PI] Giveitem doesnt work for players with spaces in name
item.dc:creator: @justinleeoglesby justinleeoglesby
item.description:
@justinleeoglesby wrote:

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“giveitem”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" “);
String name = args[1].replaceAll(”_", " ");
int item = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
int amt = Integer.parseInt(args[3]);
for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
c2.getItems().addItem(item, amt);
}
}
}

			} catch(Exception e) {
				c.sendMessage("Error.");
			}
		}[/code]

use as ::giveitem (name_2ndhalfofname) (id) (amount)

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Giveitem doesnt work for players with spaces in name

item.title: [PI] Giveitem doesnt work for players with spaces in name
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Change

String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ", 2);

to

String[] args = playerCommand.split("-", 2);

Change:

if (playerCommand.indexOf(" ") > -1

to

if (playerCommand.indexOf("-") > -1

And then you can use it as ::giveitem-playername-id-amount.

What happens is that the command uses a space to separate arguments. If they have a name that contains a space, it messes up the argument system. That’s why I like a dash “-” to separate arguments.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Giveitem doesnt work for players with spaces in name

item.title: [PI] Giveitem doesnt work for players with spaces in name
item.dc:creator: @Dario14 Dario14
item.description:
@Dario14 wrote:

Base: InsidiaX

I’ve tried to implement my ::heal (name) command which by the way does work with people that have spaces in their name with my giveitem command but i just cant get it this is my giveitem i would greatly appreciate if someone helped me with this thanks in advance

[code=java] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“giveitem”)) {

try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" “, 2);
String otherplayer = args[1];
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
//String otherplayer = args[3];
Client c2 = null;
for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(otherplayer)) {
c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
break;
}
}
}
if (c2 == null) {
c.sendMessage(“Player doesn’t exist.”);
return;
}
c.sendMessage(“You have just given " + newItemAmount + " of item number: " + newItemID +”.” );
c2.sendMessage(“You have just been given item(s).” );
c2.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} catch(Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::giveitem ID AMOUNT PLAYERNAME.”);
}
}[/code]

and this is my heal command

if (playerCommand.startsWith("heal") && c.playerRights > 2) { if (playerCommand.indexOf(" ") > -1 && c.playerRights > 1) { String name = playerCommand.substring(5); if (c.validClient(name)) { Client p = c.getClient(name); for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) { p.playerLevel[i] = p.getLevelForXP(p.playerXP[i]); p.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } p.sendMessage("You have been healed by " + c.playerName + "."); } else { c.sendMessage("Player must be offline."); } } else { for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) { c.playerLevel[i] = c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[i]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } c.freezeTimer = -1; c.frozenBy = -1; c.sendMessage("You have been healed."); } }

Read full topic
